document_data.name: Schools of Magic: Abjuration
document_data.mainbody:
'''''Schools of Magic: Abjuration''''' was a [[book]] dedicated to the basics of the [[abjuration]] school of wizardry, published sometime before the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''Creation and destruction, aye, they have their place - but what of prevention entire? The School of Abjuration is the great full stop, the "no" that meets the caster at the end of any phrase.''|Excerpt from ''Schools of Magic: Abjuration''}}
document_data.Content: The book outlined several key terms associated with this school of magic, including "banish," "prevent," "safeguard," and "stop short." Its most common magical concepts included ''[[ward]]s,'' ''[[counterspell]]s,'' ''[[dispellations of magic]]'', and magical ''[[resistance]]s''.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, several copies of ''Schools of Magic: Abjuration'' could be found around the city of [[Baldur's Gate]] and were stored and sold by the [[Sorcerous Sundries]] magic shop in the city of [[Baldur's Gate]].
